snippet: Frank Serpico, who helped uncover wrongdoing by the New York police decades ago, is at odds with a neighbor over property overlooking the Hudson.
abstract: Frank Serpico, who became one of the most famous detectives in the history of New York after helping uncover police corruption scandal in 1970s, is battling new nemesis, real estate developer in Columbia County, NY;  Serpico, who owns about 40 acres in Stuyvesant, is accusing zoning authorities of giving developer Frank Palladino preferential treatment, allowing him to endanger pristine woodlands to build luxury home.
lead_paragraph: Frank Serpico, who helped uncover wrongdoing by the New York police decades ago, is at odds with a neighbor over property overlooking the Hudson.

headline.main: In Rural Oasis, Serpico Finds New Adversaries
headline.print_headline: In Rural Oasis, Serpico Finds New Adversaries
